NewWords.WordPhrase: a. containing (too) much water 含水多的，潮湿的
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. The soup is watery.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n. a fictional being from outer space 外星人  a. of or coming from outside the Earth 地球外的，宇宙的
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. NASA has started a 10-year search for extraterrestrial intelligence.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n.  a person who always thinks that what is going to happen will be bad 悲观论者，悲观主义者    pessimistic  a.
v. move to and fro across 交叉往返（于）
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. Telephone wires crisscross the street.

NewWords.WordPhrase: (fml) because of
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. The house isn't really suitable for an old person on account of all those stairs.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n. 县治安官;行政司法长官
n. the second most important person in a particular organization 副职，副手
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. A deputy was appointed in case the manager became ill.

NewWords.WordPhrase: spend time and effort preparing; produce or develop gradually 准备，整理；逐步发展
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. The head of the department asked me to work up some sample compositions and give them to the students.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n. money paid for the support of a government 税，税款  vt. impose a tax on 对……征税
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. They're putting up the tax on cigarettes.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n. 大农场
n.  退职金； 养老金；抚恤金
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. The employees in many companies put aside money for their retirement pensions.

NewWords.WordPhrase: vt. make (a person) unable to use his/her body properly 使残废
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. In that country, the poor and disabled are left to starve on city streets.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n., a. 退伍军人（的）； 富有经验的（人）
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. By 1955 more than 2 million veterans of World War II had used the government financial aid to go to college.

NewWords.WordPhrase: a. difficult to understand or deal with 复杂的，难解的
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. The new computer is too complicated even for a skilled operator to handle.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n.  a tax collector 税务员
a. easy to talk to or deal with; friendly 可接近的，平易近人的，亲切的
n. 碟状物；飞碟；茶碟
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. cups and saucers

NewWords.WordPhrase: (infml) stop working, usu. at the end of a day
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. If I get this paper done I'll knock off early today.

NewWords.WordPhrase: (infml) go to bed
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. Louise was so tired that she hit the sack soon after supper.

NewWords.WordPhrase: vt., n. swear 诅咒，咒骂
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. They were waiting impatiently for the bus at the bus station, cursing the delay.

NewWords.WordPhrase: examine the details of, check; study or review carefully 仔细检查，核对；研究，考虑；温习
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. Go over the textbook before you take the examination.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n.  列；栏，专栏；（圆）柱
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. She added up the first column of figures and entered the total at the bottom.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n.  火箭
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. They have launched a rocket to the planet Venus.

NewWords.WordPhrase: vt.  open wide, cause to stick out; annoy 使突出，张大；打扰  n.  虫子，臭虫；毛病，故障
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. The naughty kid from next door put a frog in my mailbox, which really bugged me.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n. 面色，肤色
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. She had short brown hair and a pale complexion.

NewWords.WordPhrase: ad. for each one 每人，每个，各
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. He found the shells at a garage sale priced at 35 cents apiece.

NewWords.WordPhrase: a., ad. similar(ly) 相同的（地），相似的（地）
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. Teachers are required to treat all their students alike.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n. the act of watching attentively 观察，观测
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. Observation plays an essential part in the traditional Chinese medical practitioner's diagnoses.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n. a particular place; the position of sth. 地点；位置
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. People living in this locality complain of traffic noises disturbing them at night.

NewWords.WordPhrase: vt. set apart; cut off from others 使隔离，使孤立
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. When I'm angry, I find it best to isolate myself from other people for a little while.

NewWords.WordPhrase: vt. take over and use as one's own; take into one's family and make legal son or daughter 采用；收养
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. Some immigrants discarded their old customs and adopted American ways.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n. a manner, way or method of doing 方式，模式，样式
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. You'll have to change your mode of life once you have a baby.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n.  the way that sb./sth. looks; an act of coming into sight 外貌；出现
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. Women's magazines were full of ideas on how to make the best of one's appearance.

NewWords.WordPhrase: be attracted by; like or prefer 对……有好感；喜欢
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. Many young people go for pop music.

NewWords.WordPhrase: v.  shut and open the eyes quickly; flash on and off 眨（眼）；闪烁
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. Staring for hours at a computer screen dries out the eyes as people blink less.

NewWords.WordPhrase: without worrying about or taking account of 不顾；不管
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. Medicare, another form of federal health insurance, pays a large part of the medical bills for the disabled, regardless of age.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n. 国籍；民族
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. Her father is an American. Her mother is an Italian. What nationality is she?

NewWords.WordPhrase: willing to help sb. 愿意为某人效劳
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. If you need any help, I'm at your service.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n. 安排
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. The company tried to make flexible work arrangements so that it would make the best of all its employees.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n. 组织，机构，团体
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. The European Union, the biggest US trade partner, prepared a protest to the World Trade Organization (WTO).

NewWords.WordPhrase: a.  greatest in power, rank or degree 最高的；极度的
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. The Supreme Court meets in Washington, D.C., and the other federal courts are located in cities throughout the United States.

NewWords.WordPhrase: visit someone at their house
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. Halfway through the party, a neighbor came around to complain about the noise.

NewWords.WordPhrase: int. (used to express anger, impatience and disgust) 见鬼，该死 n. 地狱，苦境
allow one to be by oneself; allow sb. or sth. to remain untouched or unchanged 不打扰；听其自然
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. It's useless to talk to her since she is so upset; just leave her alone.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n. nonsense; rubbish 废话；垃圾，废物
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. Peter was talking a lot of garbage about education.

NewWords.WordPhrase: v. raise or lift; rise up 举起；升起
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. They had to heave the piano onto the stage.

NewWords.WordPhrase: (also wits) n. quick understanding, intelligence 智力，才智，智慧
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. He lacked the wit to respond in time.

NewWords.WordPhrase: (infml) act as if one were; pretend to be 假装；装扮作
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. The old man made like a monkey to amuse the children.

NewWords.WordPhrase: cause (sb.) to fall to the ground by pushing or hitting them; destroy and remove (sth.) 撞倒；拆毁
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. The driver was in serious trouble for knocking down a pedestrian on a pedestrian crossing.

NewWords.WordPhrase: see for a moment 一眼看见，瞥见
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. I caught sight of her just as she turned the corner and disappeared.

NewWords.WordPhrase: a. bright 有光泽的，闪耀的，发亮的
disappear gradually 逐渐消失
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. As it was getting colder and colder, their enthusiasm for doing sports in the morning faded out.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n. an inhabitant of the planet Venus 金星人
n. (infml) a stupid person 笨蛋
